docs.lead_paragraph: TWO women entered a Columbus Avenue car the other night away up town. They stood in the aisle, the only people standing. At their right were three young men engaged in a most engrossing conversation, so engrossing in fact that it was palpably but a blind. On the left was a row of men and women, all of the class that live "up town."
